extendedInfo.description: ********************************************************This demo is limited by audio dropouts! If you like this demo, please purchase the full product. ********************************************************EerieSynth is a fast, high quality, live performance-oriented, multi-touch synthesiser. EerieSynth was designed to allow fine slide-based expression in two dimensions across a familiar piano keyboard interface. Foregoing the use of samples, EerieSynth offers you access to its underlying synthesiser, featuring two oscillators with four waveforms, six types of filters and two routable LFOs, as well as the option to attach an LFO to the Y-Axis. The synthâs abilities are further increased by an analog-like delay that allows smooth delay time changing (and thus some very wacky effects), endless feedback and timbre manipulation via a lowpass and highpass filter.While EerieSynth is primarily aimed at creating expressive lead sounds, polyphony allows the creation of lush pad sounds, and the sliding interaction enables vast multitouch expression that cannot be achieved on a real synthesiser. Easily change between continuous sliding and snap-to-note if you think you have trouble staying in tune. Interestingly, EerieSynth can generate male, female and childlike voice sounds, with its carefully designed formant filters.  In this mode it is possible to manipulate the vowel in real time, to make the synth appear to speak expressively. This allows the creation of soaring soprano voices and heavy baritone growls. Perhaps most importantly, EerieSynth fills your entire screen with a variable octave keyboard, taking full advantage of both tablet and phone screens without cluttering the interface with anything that isnât necessary for your performance. The current version of EerieSynth contains a series of presets that will be expanded over time. A series of updates are planned to add additional features and functionality, and your feedback is important to us. We hope you enjoy this synthesiser, and stay with us as we improve it and release further software. 1st Creative Labswww.1stcreativesolutions.co.uk

reviews.title: Unresponsive. Pretty limited.
reviews.comment: Cool app to play around with, but couldn\'t use this for anything serious.
reviews.author: nascent nascentt

reviews.title: Major lag!
reviews.comment: As in hit a key and wait a few seconds... (other notes play fine after initial lag though)
reviews.author: Tim Howells

reviews.title: Great program! No lag. :) See below.
reviews.comment: Those of you who say its laggy.. Audio drop outs are PART of the demo limitation.  Repeatedly tap the screen and pay attention.  The \"lag\" is just the audio muting at a set interval. I wish the coder had added a visual que so folks didn\'t think it was a flaw.  The program is actual excellent. :)
reviews.author: Brandon Rulez

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: Im having big latency with my crappy phone but i guess this app is ideal for fast tablets Apart from that its amazing and im thinking of buying it when i get a tablet
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: It\'s cool, fantastic to use it when you need a cool extra sound to your band
reviews.author: Kuncoro Wicaksono

reviews.title: pretty nice
reviews.comment: but i lost the sound sometimes, maybe is because is a demo idk.
reviews.author: Adrian Balderrama

reviews.title: Can\'t Properly Evaluate
reviews.comment: I find the method used to limit this demo -- audio dropouts every 2s or so -- to be rather inappropriate. It makes it impossible to get a good feeling for how responsive the app will be, and for the sounds it will make.
reviews.author: Robin Parmar
